titleproper.value: Guide to the Fales Library and Special Collections Audio/Video Collection<lb/>1960-2011<lb/> <num>MSS.306</num>

creation.value: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace <date>2018-04-06T20:40:40</date>

unittitle.value: Fales Library and Special Collections Audio/Video Collection

p.value: Open to researchers.  Appointments are necessary for the use of manuscript and archival collections.

Published citations should take the
following form:<lb/><lb/>
Identification of item,  date (if known); Fales Library and Special Collection Audio/Video Collection; MSS 306; box number; folder number; Fales Library and Special Collections, New York University Libraries.
This collection contains primarily commerically released audio and video materials relating to the Fales Library and Special Collections.

dsc.value:

This series contains audio materials on audiocassette and CD including audiobooks, readings and interviews.

[Mrs. Corso at Keroac's Home]cuid62861963-0720185cuid6286fales_MSS306fales_MSS306_cuid6286_000001_Afales_MSS306fales_MSS306_cuid6286_000001_Bfales_MSS306fales_MSS306_cuid6286_000002_Afales_MSS306fales_MSS306_cuid6286_000002_BScope and Contents

Track 1: Men discuss the cultural concerns of their day. Beat Generation figures are mentioned (Jack Kerouac, Neal Cassady and Allen Ginsberg).

Track 2: Radio broadcasts of news and music (jazz, pop and classical).

Physical Characteristics and Technical Requirements

Original format: 1/4" Open Reel Audio, Duration: 136 min.

LeRoi Jones at Panther Benefit, Fillmore East cuid62871968-0620182cuid6287fales_MSS306fales_MSS306_cuid6287_000001Scope and Contents

Amiri Baraka (LeRoi Jones) gives a 15-minute address to an audience of Black Panther supporters, an event held at the Fillmore East in New York City, 1968.

Physical Characteristics and Technical Requirements

Original format: 1/4" Open Reel Audio, Duration: 18 min.
